Reviews.Title: “It was okay.”
Reviews.Author: AimeeKB
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel to attend an event at the University of Indianapolis. I chose the location because it was only a mile from the school and is conveniently located right off of the high way. I was not interested in anything going on in the city, so it was perfect. There were not a lot of options around for food, but the employee at the front desk gave me a handy guide to local restaurants with directions included. Check in and out were both quick and easy. The hallways have a funky smell, and even though my room and the rooms around me were all non-smoking, there seemed to be a lingering smell of cigarette. It looks like the hotel may have been somewhat remodeled recently, unfortunately it appeared to have been done quick and cheap. The room was okay. I got a single king size which left plenty of space for luggage. The bed was comfortable. It was a very spacious room. The bathroom was clean and the bathtub drained. The whole hotel was very warm and humid. There was no air circulation in my room so I turned the fan on and immediately chunks of dust came flying out at me. It was so warm in the room that I left the fan on all night and slept without any blankets. The lobby is very nice. It looked like breakfast was offered in the same area. The employees at the front counter were very nice and helpful. The only odd things I encountered were the door handles and the other guests. You have to lift the doorhandles up, rather than down. I couldn't figure out why my door wasn't opening and had to ask for help, which made me feel pretty stupid. Also, it seemed that there were a good number of male construction workers staying at this location, and every single one that I encountered gave me the creeps. During my stay I did not see another female guest, which made me slightly uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Convenient to city”
Reviews.Author: scattt
Reviews.Content: Wife, son, and I stayed here for a weekend band competition in Lucas Oil Stadium. No complaints. Hotel is showing a bit of age, but room was clean and staff was very nice. Breakfast area was crowded by 8 AM but food choices were pretty good and well stocked. It was no more than a 5 min. drive from the stadium, so convenience factor was high. We would stay there again. Only criticism is that the price - $120/night - seemed like it might be a little high compared to downtown rooms, but most of downtown was booked up for that weekend. Then again, there was no charge for parking at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value, but prepaid reservation problem...”
Reviews.Author: CaneRidgeJohnny
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the Indy 500. Very good value for the prices hotels in the area go for on that weekend. I'd stay there again if for one thing that still isn't resolved and has me hacked... we prepaid three rooms, but when we got there they could only find the prepay on two rooms and they charged my card for the third. Have tried to get it resolved many times since... they seem like they'll take care of it, but never do and I'm tired of calling back, so telling you. :) Since I paid for one room twice, not that good a value and I have to knock there service, although in other ways it was alright.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: m60freeman
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at 10pm, I was greeted with free freshly made cookies, a fruit snack, and a bottle of water (because I was a member of their free Choice Privileges program, which I signed up for when I made my online reservation). The indoor pool was small and the water looked green, but that could have been a trick of the lighting. I didn't have the time to use it anyway. The room was fine, with a comfortable bed and plenty of pillows and towels. The free breakfast was advertised as continental but included waffles as well. Check-out was painless. It has no restaurant, but is surrounded by convenient places to eat. It is a budget property (it is a converted Holiday Inn Express) and I did not expect any place fancy. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: cincyred
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a little dated but the beds were comfortable to sleep in. The indoor pool is a bit small. My only complaint is the smell of the hallways. I don't think they have any ventilation in them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhawbill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Final Four.Short trip to downtown,$15 cab ride.Standard breakfast and pool.Staff was very friendly and helpful.I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Bowden68
Reviews.Content: I usually stay downtown when I go to Indianapolis. But the Final Four was there and everything was sold out. I had an early meeting so I was fortunate to get something this close as it was less than five miles. The area is a little beat up, but not what I would deem "unsafe". The hotel istself was fine. It's an older property and I doubt it was a Holiday Inn when it was built. But the hotel was renovated and the rooms are clean, though a little small. There is a nice indoor pool and the property has no elevator. I paid the rack rate of $90 a night as priceline was not really taking bids due to the final 4. Would I stay here again? Probably not as I can priceline a 4 star hotel downtown for $50 most nights. But for one night, it was fine. 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: Deni18
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good overall. The service was great and the breakfast had a lot of options including a lot of pastries, cereal, yogurt and different choices of juice. The room was pretty nice and clean with the 2 queen beds being comfortable. There was a small table and 2 chairs which were great for playtesting for the the card tournament I was going too and the TV had a variety of channels. I was especially happy with a computer in the lobby that you could use for free, which also had free internet. The only problems were that the 2 days I came back I got notes saying that the staff could not clean my room fully because I left things laying on the bed. I don't really agree with this policy as it doesn't seem to be that much work to take the stuff off and put it back but I guess that's just me. Apart from this everything was good and I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “a good value”
Reviews.Author: roadtripper10
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to meet my expectation for a Holiday Inn Express. It seems like it is an older hotel, but clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The pool was closed during my stay, but the staff offered the opportunity to use the pool at another Holiday Inn close by. The work out room was small (treadmill bike and stairclimber), but I had no competition for the equipment. The parking lot is adjoining with a Wendy's which I found to be very convenient. The breakfast was very nice and the eating area was clean. I would stay there again. I (a single female business traveler) felt very safe and comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “Flooding of the bathroom from the room above and noisy neighbors”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had anticipated a nice hotel stay after reading the reviews but were VERY disappointed! When we arrived the staff was friendly but we found the room to be not to our expectations in quality. We had extremely noisy neighbors from the room above us and at about 12:30 AM we heard popping sounds and realized that the bathroom in our room was being flooded from water pouring out of the ceiling. When we called the front desk he said that he knew and was the only one there to deal with the problem. I called the front desk again when he did not come to see the situation and later he arrived with some towels to mop up the water that was still dripping from the ceiling. This water was from the toilet upstairs and was everywhere including our toilet, towels, counter, toilet paper etc. When we said that we did not want to stay in that room he said that they had no other rooms. I then asked for our money back so that we could go to another hotel. After a delay he did refund our money but he offered no apology whatsoever. After this experience we will no longer stay at a Holiday Inn hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Joebaba
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 nights during the Indy 500 weekend in May 2005. The first night I paid for, the next 3 nights were free on points. The hotel raises its rates on Indy weekend, but not as much as many other hotels in the area. The regular rate (non-race weekends) seems quite reasonable. The hotel was very good. It was clean and quiet and the breakfast was above average - they even had omelettes 2 of the 4 days. The workout room was a little lacking, with 2 out of the 3 fitness machines broken, and the pool was a little green. The staff was cheerful and very helpful. All in all a fine stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: packman8484
Reviews.Content: Juststayed here last weekend while in town to see the Packers play the Colts. Location was about 5 miles to downtown, just a quick drive. Service was exceptional, they have a very friendly and helpful staff. The only thing I didn't care for was the pool. It's very small and to me just didn't look as clean as I'd like it to. Other than that, rooms were clean. Defintely a good choice if your passin through or on a budget.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3514 South Keystone Avenue, Indianapolis, IN 46227 (Formerly Holiday Inn Express )
